CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 2, 1946, pg. 9, reads: "UNITED IN MARRIAGE - Mr. and Mrs. Milteon Charlton, newlyweds, cut their wedding cake at the reception which followed their Feb. 10 marriage at the home of the bride. Mrs. Charlton is the former Miss Jean Allen, granddaughter of the Mr. and Mrs. Robert Harris of Bedford Avenue.   Rev. Cornell Talley performed the ceremony.  Matron of honor was Mrs. Yvonne Traynham.  Best man was George N. Charlton Jr.  Flower girl, Gloria Allen.  The bride's grandmother, Mrs. Harris, celebrated her birthday the same day as the wedding. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women, including bride Jean Allen Charlton wearing gown with long train and lace trimmed veil, matron of honor Yvonne Traynham; men, including groom Milton "Mickey" Charlton, best man George N. Charlton Jr.; and flower girl Gloria Allen, posed behind three tiered wedding cake inscribed "Jean & Milton" in domestic interior, possibly in Harris home, Bedford Avenue, another version
